WRITING.TITLE: Any advice?
WRITING.TEXT: To preface I am 5 #8217; and 135~lbs but I want to weigh at least 125. I know to some it may not seem like that big of a deal but I am also a swimmer and I know besides aesthetics I just swim better at that weight. ( if i can get to 115 that would be wonderful ) unfortunately I tend to binge eat every once and a while and 4 years ago I was down to 119 but I just can #8217;t seem to stick to everything and I am honestly losing hope. I have tried to count calories and that worked 4 years ago but now nothing seem to work. Sorry for the long text but any advice would be appreciated!
I was also in this situation as a 13 year old! I used my fitness pal to track my calories and somehow managed to stick to it and lose ~25 pounds

I always go for the feeling of exercise. I find that if I focus on how exercise makes me feel, it #8217;s easier to do it again. I personally like the feeling of working my muscles in just the right way. On days when I don #8217;t feel good or I can #8217;t work as hard as I want to/ normally do, I just tell myself that for today this is the best I can do. I try and work trough the hard days with the mindset that when I get to the good days, it #8217;s more of a treat. Idk if that makes sense.
...what #8217;s an OB?
Yeah im 18. Do you know if it will show up on some kind of statement? Also I don #8217;t know if I #8217;d even be able to make an appointment without when knowing why
I agree!! 12lbs is my goal rn so it so cool to hear about other people making it happen!!
Yes!!! Sometimes it feel like my heart is just beating all throughout my chest. It #8217;s like a deeper heavier heart beat, not faster but just like a deep beat of sadness lmao.

Yeah I get this too. It #8217;s really strange because I #8217;m pretty sure I want these people in my life but at the same time I never want to actually hang out with them? Idk it #8217;s very contradictory. Like for instance, my best friend came over today for the first time in about a month, we talked today for the first time in 2 weeks and I was just so tired at some points. She even asked me before she left #8220;can you please try not to stop talking to me for another 2 weeks? #8221; (Don #8217;t get me wrong she didn #8217;t mean it in a petty way she was just genuinely sad I hadn #8217;t talked to her in so long) I don #8217;t know what to do with myself half the time cuz I could just so easily never talk to anyone

Yeah I sometimes wish I could talk to her about these things but I #8217;ve just never done so. It seems like she vaguely knows about what I #8217;ve been dealing with and she has been supper supportive of me whoever I get into a weird funk. Some how I just don #8217;t want to bring it up...
Yesss gurl getting snatched!!
I just wanted to add, as long as it #8217;s not a sharp searing pain most of it is just from your muscles working hard. Keep up the good work!

I know I #8217;m not a professional but maybe you #8217;re restricting too much in the first place. I know from my own personal experience that whenever I restrict my intake too much I always end up binging later on and then I regret it. If you want to keep counting calories maybe move up to 1500 and focus on balancing every meal with protein, veggies, and grains. I always try and leave room for a treat at the end of the day because I have a major sweet tooth.

1200 is way too low for anyone to be eating. Your metabolism has probably slowed down because it believes your body is in a #8220;starved #8221; state. This can explain why you can seem to lose weight even though you keep going into a calorie deficit. At the very least you should be eating 1500

You should be focusing on nutritionally dense foods such as vegetables, whole grains, and lean meats. If you make sure to include these in every meal it should significantly decrease the amount of times you find yourself craving more. Plus drink LOTS of water and I mean like 60- 80oz per day and even more if your work out regularly. If you #8217;ve been counting your calories at 1200 it will take a while to rebuilding your metabolism so don #8217;t be discouraged if you don #8217;t see results. Focus on how your body feels! You can still count your calories using apps like MyFitnessPal but try not to get hung up on being EXACTLY on target every day. I said 1500 but your current weight and daily activities are huge factors in setting a relevant goal in calories. For example some who is 5 #8217;2 #8221;, 135, and is an athlete could need anyway from 2300-3000 calories per day to even maintain weight. In comparison some one who is the same weight and height who is an office worker with little to no other activity could need 1800-2100 to maintain.

WRITING.TITLE: Empty
WRITING.TEXT: I feel like no one knows me here. No one knows how messed up I really am in life and I feel like a fake. I feel like I #8217;m misleading everyone around me but I don #8217;t want them to think horribly of me in the first place. They all seem so pure and nice and I don #8217;t want to hurt them...
Peak humor

Strangely I doing the best and worst I ever have in my life. I feel like I #8217;m constantly oscillating between living on top of the world and getting work done and feeling like shit and wanting to sh. I feel so lonely and want help but I #8217;m so alone here and no one knows me
^^^ id also really appreciate hearing some of these
Or even just on the bandage. Cuz then u have to rip it open all over again...
I would def say a cleaner and also a more consistent diet.

Yeah I had something somewhat similar...I didn #8217;t know if I should #8217;ve felt more relieved or hurt that she knew and never did anything. Not that I knew exactly what I wanted her to do in the first place
Big L

WRITING.TITLE: Bipolar ?
WRITING.TEXT: I need help please...I #8217;m not really one to self diagnose and I #8217;ve seen doctors before for general depression/anxiety but I sometimes wonder if I #8217;m bipolar... I really feel like my energy and mood switched too fast for me to keep up with sometimes and I hate it so much. I just want to feel better and I don #8217;t even want to have another thing #8220;wrong #8221; with me...
Idek if I should be supporting this but what a legend

WRITING.TITLE: Quarantine
WRITING.TEXT: Does anyone else feel like they functioned better in quarantine? Honestly when I was alone with myself...I feel like I was so much more productive. Once I got into a routine of doing work, eating right, and exercising I felt like I was doing better mentally than I honestly ever had in my life. (Not gonna lie tho before this happened I was in a trash state) but now that school has started I feel like everything I built up was just destroyed in a second... I feel so hopeless all over again.
Brooo can #8217;t I just give in~

^^^ I honestly feel 10x worse rn and I don #8217;t know what to do. I can #8217;t just wish everything would go back to how it was in quarantine but I don #8217;t know what else to do ... reality is hard...
^^^ sleep use to be something I dreaded for the longest time and I would try anything to avoid it...I ended up passing out a lot in class and being just in a super bad state.
Ow
AHAHA NOOO DONT LET ANYONE TELL U YOU CANT. But really you don #8217;t need to be #8220;qualified #8221;
No yeah idk...I just feel like I personally accomplished more things while in quarantine when no one told me to do anyway...it #8217;s kinda whimpy but I guess that #8217;s who I am
The amount I felt this one...

WRITING.TITLE: Losing feelings
WRITING.TEXT: Dae know what to do when you start losing all interest in the things you once loved? I feel like I #8217;m losing everything that made me who I was. I feel so lost and wish I could be as excited to do the things that I use to look forward to when I woke up...
Thanks for your support. Idk it #8217;s just very hard to do anything rn but I #8217;ll try and keep moving ..
It #8217;s the #10024;evolution #10024; for me
PERIODT
What a mooood. And the worst part is that you have to make a cut worthy of the new bandages... Rip this kinda sucks
This happened to me and a roommate

WRITING.TITLE: Regain
WRITING.TEXT: Guys I recently lost 12 pounds over quarantine and I was only 10 more away from my goal. But ever since starting college I #8217;ve already gained the freshman 15 and I #8217;m starting to lose hope. I just feel so frustrated that I let myself gain that much in such a short period of time. Does anyone have any advice or have been through similar things? I #8217;m just feeling pretty down about it and am trying to pick myself back up...
I have this issue. It #8217;s always #8220;but I can #8217;t tell! #8221; Yeah no shit.... Anyway
